sentences.en: Carelessness in their tone of voice, often speaking in gruff, antagonistic tones.
sentences.cn: 不注意自己说话的语气, 经常以不悦而且对立的语气说话.

sentences.en: Cats and mouses are often antagonistic.
He is always antagonistic towards new ideas.
sentences.cn: 他对新思想总是持反对态度.

sentences.en: In ordinary circumstances, contradictions among the people are not antagonistic.
sentences.cn: 在一般情况下, 人民内部的矛盾不是对抗性的.

sentences.en: It is antagonistic abscisic acid in abscission.
sentences.cn: 在脱落过程中生长素与脱落酸有拮抗作用。

sentences.en: It's dreadful when two people's senses of humor are antagonistic.
sentences.cn: 两人的幽默感互相对立是难以想象的.

sentences.en: Nearly all the women I interviewed were aggressively antagonistic to the idea.
sentences.cn: 几乎我采访过的所有女性都对这个观点表示了强烈的反感。

sentences.en: Some people react so strongly against television news, alleging antagonistic bias.
sentences.cn: 有些人对电视新闻反应很强烈, 表示出对抗性的偏见.

sentences.en: The contradictions between ourselves and the enemy are antagonistic contradictions.
sentences.cn: 敌我之间的矛盾是对抗性的矛盾.

sentences.en: The emotional qualities are antagonistic to clear reasoning.
sentences.cn: 感情作用会影响清醒的理智.

sentences.en: The Formation of Sino - American Antagonistic Relation ( 1949 - 1953 )
The result above demonstrated that NO had antagonistic action on above - mentioned effect.
sentences.cn: 上述结果提示,NO对前述影响有拮抗作用.

sentences.en: They merely stirred in a nervous and wholly antagonistic way.
sentences.cn: 他们只是神经质地,带着完全敌对情绪地骚动了一下.

words.tran_cn: 敌手；[解剖] 对抗肌；[生化] 拮抗物；反协同试剂
使…敌对；使…对抗；对…起反作用

trans.tran_en: unfriendly; wanting to argue or disagree
